meanings.definition: To make a second bid in a card game.
meanings.sent1: During the game, players can rebid to show they want to continue playing.
meanings.sent2: In card games, it is common to rebid when you have a strong hand.
meanings.sent3: The players decided to rebid, causing excitement around the table.
meanings.sent4: Her rebid signaled her determination to win the round.
meanings.sent5: With a confident smile, he announced his rebid to challenge the other players.

meanings.definition: To make a new bid in an auction.
meanings.sent1: The auctioneer asked if anyone wanted to rebid on the painting.
meanings.sent2: When the bidding slowed down, she decided to rebid to stay in the auction.
meanings.sent3: Seeing no other bids, she chose to rebid playfully, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His rebid for the antique vase was met with eager anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The room fell silent as she prepared to rebid for the rare collectible item.

meanings.definition: To bid again in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: After losing the initial bid, he had to rebid to stay in the competition.
meanings.sent2: Competitors often rebid to show their commitment to winning.
meanings.sent3: She decided to rebid, hoping to outsmart her opponents.
meanings.sent4: His rebid for the project was bold and caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The team's decision to rebid surprised their rivals and showed their determination.
